page.title: 13Ravensthorpe Wool Festival
page.content: Ravensthorpe decided to have a festival in June 1982 as a social event and to raise money for social amenities.With rural life in mind,a theme of 'wool' was chosen.Various craftsmen and crafts women demonstrated their skills and wares in gardens around the village.Our main event was making the Althorpe Coat We would try to make a replica of the Throckmorton Coat of 1811,duplicating the conditions of sheep shearing,wool spinning,washing and drying the cloth & cutting and sewing the coat in less than the original time of 13 hours 20 minutes.The shearer took just 4 minutes to shear each of the 17 Jacobs sheep. From the spinners the wool was handed to weavers,carders,teasers and tailors 30 in all.A large crowd gathered to see it made with only 12 minutes to spare. The coat was then worn by Viscount Althorpe,a successful weekend.
